titles.title: A bill to improve the transition between experimental permits and commercial licenses for commercial reusable launch vehicles.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

calendar.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Reported by Senator Rockefeller with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 612.

action.text: By Senator Rockefeller from Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation filed written report. Report No. 113-318.

bill.summary:
3/13/2014--Introduced. Amends commercial space launch licensing requirements.
Authorizes the Secretary of Transportation (DOT) to issue an experimental permit for a particular reusable suborbital rocket (as under current law) or rocket design after a license has been issued for the launch or reentry of a rocket of that design. Declares that any permits already issued shall remain valid for research and development (R&D) and other specified purposes.
